body: This issue bounces back and forwards now: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/3293 look at the two issues in the PR.
I think we either enforce `defaultValue` or not, otherwise the `infer` is getting confused and leads to type error.
or enforce the generic at `useForm` to avoid this confusing.
I read those issues, and IMO being explicit on the generic at useForm<T> instead of infering from default values is more precise.

> I read those issues, and IMO being explicit on the generic at useForm instead of infering from default values is more precise.

I think I am lean towards that as well, otherwise, it's a never-ending issue we are in a loop now...

issue.title: Version 6.9.3â€“6.9.6 broke many TypeScript type definitions

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body: **Describe the bug** Updating from 6.9.2 to the latest version (6.9.6) completely breaks my TypeScript app. There are too many different type errors to list, but what I've seen so far was: 1. `defaultValues` complaining `Type 'null' is not assignable to type '{} | undefined'.` 2. `errors` type error 3. `watch` type error **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Have a working TypeScript app on version 6.9.2 2. Upgrade to version 6.9.6 3. Try to compile the app **Codesandbox link (Required)** [CodeSandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/tender-lake-qxnu4?file=/src/App.tsx) **Expected behavior** The app compiles without any errors. **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: [e.g. iOS] - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari] - Version [e.g. 22] **Smartphone (please complete the following information):** - Device: [e.g. iPhone6] - OS: [e.g. iOS8.1] - Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari] - Version [e.g. 22] **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.

issue.title: DeepMap error when spreading on `defaultValues`

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**

Go to sandbox.

View the `defaultValues` section -- comment out the spreaded and uncomment the non spreaded.. notice the typescript error difference


**Codesandbox link (Required)**

https://codesandbox.io/s/dry-violet-z0tpe

**Expected behavior**

Types inferred without DeepMap error on the overridden defaultValues

**Screenshots**

body: I have cc the relevant people who reported the issue, I think we can have a conclusion here that generic at the useForm is potentially necessary and will be documented down, so we don't have regression like this again.
@ejose19 can you please update your CSB? it's probably not saved.

@bluebill1049 done. Sure, let's hear others opinions. But being explicit at the start (useForm generic) should make users detect errors earlier in case defaultValues didn't contain all form properties.
I agree with @ejose19, unless someone else has a better idea, otherwise, we will lock it in, fix it and update the doc.

I, too, have no problem with the generic. However, I have some questions:

1. Why is this suddenly an issue? What changed? I'm not aware of this being a problem prior to `6.9.3`.
2. Can you post an example of what `useForm()` would look like with a generic?

> I, too, have no problem with the generic. However, I have some questions:
> 
> 1. Why is this suddenly an issue? What changed? I'm not aware of this being a problem prior to `6.9.3`.

it was due to the type change, which is what i have switch back and forward with, I think I finally figure this out now... bit late.

> 2. Can you post an example of what `useForm()` would look like with a generic?

`useForm<{ ... }>`
@ejose19 looks like this fix the issue: https://codesandbox.io/s/priceless-resonance-k7hml?file=/src/App.tsx
